Do you use a hair band to put your hair up? When your hair isn’t up, do you wear the hair band around your wrist for safe keeping until you do want to put your hair up? Then instead of just having it on your wrist, why not make it look funky and cool! This eBook will show you a few different styles for using hair bands to decorate your hand and wrist, with step-by-step guides on how to create each one.
When you’ve mastered each style in this book you can visit our blog at BandItGuide.blogspot.com and find even more funky cool designs. You can even submit your own creative styles!
Have fun, stay safe, and get to creating!

Always make sure your bands are never too tight and cut off circulation. If they do this, please remove the band immediately and choose a different band that is a little looser. When wearing these styles also be aware that they can catch on things, just like when you wear them around your wrist. Now, throughout the book we will use this diagram to help explain the process for making each style: (all instructions are written for creating designs on your left hand)
First, we’ll start out showing you how to connect two bands. (You’ll use this process a lot when creating most of the styles.)
Step 1: Lay both bands so that they are overlapping.
Step 2: Pinch together the opposite sides of the band on bottom so that it curves around the other band.
Step 3: Grab the band on the right by the loop on top and pull it under the bottom loop.
Step 4: Pull the loop all the way through until the right band is snug around the left band.
